item.title: Multichannel Lockin v2.26.0.31
item.description:
Product: Multichannel Lockin v2.26.0.31
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Thu, 18 Sep 2025 20:39:07 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Multichannel Lockin for National Instruments' Dynamic Signal Acquisition hardware (4431, 4461, 4462).
- This version is configured to handle multiple cards for simultaneous, synchronized AI/AO.
- The analog outputs can be configured to output sine, square, sawtooth, or triangle functions with (swept) DC offsets.
- Each of the analog inputs can be demodulated at multiple frequencies.

Release Notes: [2.26.0]
- fix bug calculating Fs for lockin filter
- fix bug in which AI was routed to AO
- revert filters to "2.15.4"-style

#### Dependencies
- Please ensure that [Visual C++ Redistributable Packages for Visual Studio 2013](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40784) is installed. The bitness must match the application you're targeting.
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Transport v2.0.4.34
item.description:
Product: Transport v2.0.4.34
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Thu, 18 Sep 2025 08:34:09 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: VIs for scripting and performing transport measurments.

[Control Experiment]
- Control Experiment.vi
- provides a uniform way to record information about your sample & device
- record how the lockin is connected to the device
- configure the Krohn Hite amplifier
- set the base path for saving data
- configure peripheral instruments
- APIs for recording sample data, instrument status

[Transport]
Basic transport measurments:
- Lockin vs time (Lockin_time.vi)
- Lockin Sweep Mode (Lockin_sweep.vi)

[Transport Server]
Server used for scripting and performing asynchronous transport measurments.


Release Notes: [2.0.4]
- Issue #142 fix bad cast from numeric to instrument type enum
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Multichannel Lockin v2.25.6.30
item.description:
Product: Multichannel Lockin v2.25.6.30
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Wed, 17 Sep 2025 14:41:18 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Multichannel Lockin for National Instruments' Dynamic Signal Acquisition hardware (4431, 4461, 4462).
- This version is configured to handle multiple cards for simultaneous, synchronized AI/AO.
- The analog outputs can be configured to output sine, square, sawtooth, or triangle functions with (swept) DC offsets.
- Each of the analog inputs can be demodulated at multiple frequencies.

Release Notes: [2.25.6]
- change 'getSweepData' timeout to 25,000 ms
- other improvements to reduce memory and CPU usage


#### Dependencies
- Please ensure that [Visual C++ Redistributable Packages for Visual Studio 2013](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40784) is installed. The bitness must match the application you're targeting.

item.title: RemoteControl.ZMQ v1.3.2.23
item.description:
Product: RemoteControl.ZMQ v1.3.2.23
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Tue, 09 Sep 2025 12:11:08 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Override library implementing ZMQ lazy pirate reliable request reply (RRR) protocal using RemoteControl SMO framework.

Release Notes: [1.3.2]
#187: fix libzmq64.lvclass inheritance
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Sweep Control v2.0.0.13
item.description:
Product: Sweep Control v2.0.0.13
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Tue, 09 Sep 2025 11:58:56 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: [SweepControl.lvclass]
- Sweep Control.vi:
- Sequencer for stepping multiple parameters. Calls VIs in Transport.lvclass
- Continuous B sweep.vi:
- Sweep B continuously while asynchronously calling VIs in Transport.lvclass

Release Notes: [2.0.0]
#141 Update compatibility with Transport 2.0
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.15.9.45
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.15.9.45
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Mon, 08 Sep 2025 13:49:07 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh.

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Framework for communicating with hardware (Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either NI's Simple Messaging Library (STM) (deprecated in v1.9) or cross-platform protocol ZMQ (preferred beginning with v1.9))
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

Release Notes: [1.15.9]
#185 update dependencies
item.dc:creator: LevyLab
